visualization_prompt: Generate a sunburst chart showing hierarchical distribution of International Space Station visitors using color-coded continent/country levels
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains hierarchical categorical data with two levels of granularity: continents (parent nodes) and countries (child nodes). Each node carries a quantitative value (visitor count) following a part-whole relationship. Synthetic data maintains proportional validity with America (μ=160, σ=71.6) dominating visitor counts, while European countries show uniform distribution (σ=1.3). Values sum hierarchically (e.g., Americas total = US+CA+BR = 160). The sunburst chart maximizes data-ink ratio by encoding values through arc lengths and using grayscale colors for categorical distinction. Following Cairo's principles, pre-attentive color intensity differences (from #ffffff to #000000) create immediate continent/country differentiation. Level-based labeling ensures readability by only showing labels on sufficiently large segments.
